article.headline: West Virginia 87, Marshall 76
article.story: CHARLESTON, W.Va. -- Freshman Darryl Bryant scored a season-high 22 points and West Virginia used a fast start to beat Marshall 87-76 on Wednesday night. West Virginia (12-4) coasted to its third straight win over intrastate rival Marshall (8-8). It marked only the second time in their last 11 meetings that a team won by double digits. Bryant hit two 3-pointers in the first two minutes of the second half and Alex Ruoff had another to extend West Virginia's 11-point halftime lead to 43-23. Da'Sean Butler added 17 points, Ruoff scored 15 and Devin Ebanks had 12 for West Virginia. Shaquille Johnson scored 15 points and Markel Humphrey added 13 for Marshall, which lost for the third time in four games. Marshall's Tyler Wilkerson, who averaged 20 points and 11 rebounds in his three previous games, fouled out with 7:20 left and finished with nine points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
